英文法規名稱: Regulations Governing Approval of Registration and Management of Business Entities Setting up Operation or Liaison Offices within the Export Processing Zone
中文法規名稱: 在加工出口區內設有營業或聯絡處所之事業核准登記管理辦法
沿革內容:
1.Promulgated on November 28, 2001
2.Amended on April 7, 2004
3.Amended on May 6, 2008 
4.Amended on February 13, 2012

法規內容.條文內容: These regulations are prescribed in accordance with the provisions of Paragraph 6, Article 10-1 of the Statute for the Establishment and Administration of Export Processing Zone.

Business entities that meet any of the following conditions may apply to set up operation or liaison offices within the Export Processing Zone:
1. Companies, firms, foundations or juridical associations outside the Zone, specialized technicians who have completed the Practice Registration or foreign companies which applied to the Central Government for a Record Entry pursuant to Article 386 of the Company Act.
2. Types of business operated in accordance with the types of business allowed to set up operation or liaison offices within the Zone.
Except for the gas station and truck freight transportation industries, business entities may apply to the Local Administration of the Zone  or its branch Office for Company Registration, which are not subject to the limitation concerning companies outside of the Zone as mentioned above in Paragraph 1.

Business entities which apply to set up operation or liaison offices within the Zone shall first obtain approval from the Export Processing Zone Administration (hereinafter referred to as the Administration) or its branches, before applying for Registration. However, freight forwarders, customs brokers, insurance agencies, service sectors offering waste disposal and recycling services, law and accounting firms, as well as postal saving and remittance service providers, shall apply for Approval and Registration at the same time.

Applicants who obtained approval for the above mentioned application shall fill in an application form and submit the following documents:
1. Photocopies of certificates or proofs of operation or practice, or official records issued to companies, businesses, foundations, juridical associations, specialized technicians, or foreign companies’ operation or the liaison offices in Taiwan
2. Photocopies of the identification documents of the responsible person
3. A business plan
4. Other required documents
Freight forwarders and express delivery companies transporting goods out of the Export Processing Zone or delivering goods from foreign countries into the Export Processing Zone shall submit the following additional documents along with the documents listed in the preceding paragraph:
1. Vehicle registration documents
2. A Proof of Duty Payment for the latest quarter
3. Photocopies of each driver’s driving license
4. Affidavits sworn and signed by drivers or operators of the applicant companies to comply with the traffic regulations and any other regulation concerning the Export Processing Zone, when working inside the Zone
5. Photocopies of membership cards issued by Cargo Transportation Associations
6. Photocopies of the valid bonded truck licenses issued by the Customs Authority (for bonded goods carriers)
Basic information about the applicant company, the address of its liaison office, the types of its operation and its financial plans shall be included in its business plan as mentioned in Subparagraph 3 of Paragraph 1.

For freight forwarders and express delivery companies which set up operation or liaison offices within each of the Zones and registration applications to the Administration or its branches, a pass will be issued to each of their vehicles; once issued, the pass shall be renewed every two years.

Business entities applying to register their operation or liaison offices within the Zone shall submit an application form and the following documents to the Administration having jurisdiction over their offices or its branches:
1. Photocopies of certificates or proofs of operation, practice, or official records issued to companies, businesses, foundations, juridical associations, specialized technicians, or foreign companies’ operation or the liaison offices in Taiwan
2. Photocopies of the business licenses issued by the competent authority  (for businesses that require a special permission to start business operations)
3. Photocopies of the identification documents of the responsible person or of the person in charge of the business within the Zone
4. Certificates of the using land or the building within the Zone where the operation or liaison office is located, as well as a leased land plan or a building plan in which the leased area is indicated
5. Photocopies of the approval documents issued by the Administration or its branches
A registration certificate will be issued by the Administration or its branches after the preceding application has been approved.

The Administration or its branches shall approve or reject applications for approval and registration of business entities setting up operation or liaison offices within the Zone within 30 days (holidays not included) after receiving the applications, except when supplementary documents or corrections are required.

The following information shall be recorded by the Administration or its branches while processing the applications for registration of business entities setting up operation or liaison offices within the Zone:
1. Name of the operation or liaison office
2. Person in charge of the business within the Zone
3. Address of the operation or liaison office
4. The type of business entity of the  approved operation or liaison office
5. Area of land or building being occupied by the operation or liaison office
6. Name, address and responsible person for the headquarters
7. Vehicles used by the freight forwarders to transport goods out of the Export Processing Zone and deliver goods from foreign countries into the Export Processing Zone

For any changes in the information provided about the business entities having set up operation or liaison offices within the Zone, the person in charge of the business within the Zone shall submit an application form for registration of change and the other relevant documents to the local Administration or its branches within 15 days from the day when the changes take place.

The establishment and the operations of those business entities having set up operation or liaison offices within the Zone shall comply with the relevant regulations concerning construction, fire protection, safety and hygiene as well as environmental protection.

The Administration or its branches may assign a specific location to the business entity having set up an operation or liaison office within the Zone, according to the relevant industrial classification, when it applies for a location for its operations.

Business entities having set up operation or liaison offices within the Zone shall apply for passes to be issued to their personnel and vehicles by the Administration having jurisdiction over their offices or its branches.
Personnel and vehicles entering and exiting the Export Processing Zone shall undergo mandatory inspection by the Administration, its branches, the Customs Administration or the security guards. Roads must be kept unobstructed during business operation.
Trucks, containers and machines entering the Zone for loading and unloading operations shall exit the Zone prior to 9 p.m. on the same day and cannot be left in the Zone after this time.
Trucks and tractors entering the Zone for loading and unloading operations may be equipped with a maximum of two trailers.

When terminating their business within the Zone, business entities having set up operation or liaison offices within the Zone shall apply to the local Administration or its branches for the annulment of the registration and the cancelation of the registration certificate; for companies registered in the Zone without any other operation or liaison office outside of the Zone, dissolution of the company and removal from the Export Processing Zone should be processed at the same time.
The regulations shall come into force from the date of promulgation.
